name: Here Is The News
description:
Definitions:

  • RND defence: Wall of Thorns, Caduceus, RSVP
  • Rushing remote: 2x Rototurret/PaperWall/RSVP
  • Taxing remote: RSVP + Sansan + Bernice Mai

Strategy:

  • put some ice on the centrals
  • go for the rushing remote
  • solidify your centrals, try to aim for the go-to RND defence
  • use Power Shutdown to keep the rushing remote valid and keep on scoring
  • when the rushing remote is no longer valid go for the taxing remote

Some explanations:

  • TGTBT is just another way of losing Kati Jones or getting Close Accounted (this deck doesn't want to click on Gila anyway)
  • with Sweeps Week, Popups and Caduceuses this deck has no issues landing Restructure
  • SFS is there for Siphon defence (keep that astro train a threat even then)
  • 3x3 cheap ETR (or almost ETR) ice for the rushing remote (rotos, papers, rsvps)
  • Wall of Thorns is my biggie of choice because: it has multiple subs - so will cost 2 if Femmed, suits my plan of utilizing the unready breaker suite bottleneck to score agendas (lose an icebreaker by a surprise dmg anybody?), and has no drawback apart from dying to the out-of-meta Morningstar
  • Jackson is there for all the reasons + safe Power Shutdowns

I had enormous success with this deck. What do you think?

name: Shut Archives Down v2
description: A close idea to Spam that Button, but without showing the runner what you are doing. Use Power Shutdown to add Shocks and 1pt agendas in archives. Use Jackson to remove any Fetal AI and Snares from there and use interns to use archives as an extension to your HQ. Do not overuse PS, use it to trash some key runner program. Use Jackson Howard buy ability as a weak Panic Button if you need more damage at the archives. Play it as a no advance, keep Fetal AI and Snares in your hand all the time (you may keep a shock too) and scores the single braintrust ASAP. v2 I changed the ICE layout. Added viper for AS, and punitive counterstrike to kill the runner or to keep him at bay while you score an agenda (like braintrust)

name: Why Not Play To Lose
description: How quickly can you lose a Netrunner match? I reckon this is the best legal deck for it.

name: The Ivory Tower 2.1 (looking for help)
description: Trying to create a professor deck. I have no idea what im doing.

name: NBN Silver
description:
NBNFA, an updated take on my Nationals thru Worlds build, although I have less tag punishment now, which makes me a little uneasy. I haven't been letting myself play this archetype, so this ICE and econ package need tweaking.

Economic package: I used to be running 3x Beanstalk, 3x GLC, which I've converted into 3x Sweeps, 2x Restructure. Higher rewards, but riskier. On the plus side, that let me swap Bernice (who always underperformed) for Ash.

ICE package: now has 3x TMI and 1x Archer as the big bads, instead of only 2x Tollbooth.

name: The Ivory Tower 2.2
description: got rid of RDI and added an imp and a faerie

name: Floating Wizard
description:
I've had decent succes with this. Basically: Don't care about tags. Get Plascrete out ASAP, install John Masanori and DLR again and again and watch them get trashed.

Because we can't have Kati Jones/Liberated Accounts/Daily Casts, Account Siphon is our main source of income, along with other burst econ and 3 Same Old Thing, to do it again.

A very fun deck to play!

name: Jinteki Fast Advance...if you'd like that is
description:
This deck uses some of the tricks a normal fast advance deck employs but it's main goal is not to win by scoring at 7 points as quickly as possible. With Ronin, Junebug, and Ice Wall you can set up some advancements to be moved with ToL to agendas for quick points or you can move them over to traps and snag an unsuspecting runner. While you can win both by net damage or agenda scoring, you can roll with whatever strategy you'd like.

I like to draw the game out and set up a few traps with ronin or junebug before getting the right combo of cards for a quick agenda score (San San, ToL, Shipment, etc). Sometimes I like to throw them off and install an agenda in a remote with some ice over it and advance it 5 times quickly but not score it. Usually they'll think it's trap so they'll leave it alone and I can score it in a close situation. I employ the same strategy with two fully advanced ronin and win the game with net damage.

name: Simple Kit
description: You know the basic idea, get decoder and run wild! Derez the outermost ice with Crescentus and use parasites to destroy inner ice. Rinse and Repeat. On the choice of breakers, I choose g-blade because its more flexible than cyber-cypher and cheaper than torch. It also doesn't require much support like yog does in the late game. Please put the pipeline on dino...it will save you so much money in the long run. I have one more influence to use...any suggestions where it should go?
